review: Lovin' the Royal.  It reminds me of Pulp Fiction every time I order it and ask for a Roy-Al.

The food here is usually pretty good. Staff is courteous, and the Manager was very understanding. Unfortunately it seems like the staff needs work on speed of service and hosting tables. When we got there, we were told that there's a 10 to 15 minute wait for a table. Yet right to our left was an empty booth! I figured that they were going to fill it with a group of 4 or so customers. But when we were seated, it was still a booth! Just up the ramp instead. My gf and I waited about 50 min for food. Not cool. Hope things get better quick, or they will end up like the one on Shields.

This Red Robin has the worst customer service ever, every time my family and I go to this location, they make us feel uncomfortable. They just stare at us like its the first time they have ever seen Latinos before. The wait is long to be seated and the place can be empty and we still wait long. The Hosts flat out suck, the waiters are hit and miss, the food takes awhile to arrive even when the place is empty. I live near river park, and my family and I just drive across the way to the Clovis location by Sierra Vista Mall, where we always feel welcomed and receive customer service with a smile. This place needs under cover boss to check this lame place out.
I go here all the time with my grandma every time I go to her house.the burgers are delicious but the atmosphere is just ok. Food:A+ Cleanliness:A Service:A+

Much like other reviews here. Terrible customer service at this location. Definitely prefer the Shaw/Valentine location. They're friendly there and never make you feel rushed. Yes sir, I would like to have more than one bite of my burger before you give me my check, but yes, sit in that corner folding napkins starring as you wait for us to pay. Ridiculous.

Ive been reading other review about service and I agree.  All but one Server/Bartender (Jerry) great I have called to see if he is working if he is not I will head somewhere else.  No joke I have tried other servers but they are Rude and always seem to be in a rush to get me out of there and get there tip. Food is very good Chicken Teriyaki sandwich,Wings.and The Burgers are great. Store really needs to be updated.  very old feeling inside really does not fit into that area of town.
I love Red Robin's just not this particular Red Robin's personnel.
Got the tavern burger combo.  It was good, juicy and fresh.  Customer service was friendly also.
Good food rib sandwich wife had burning love burger it was good it took a little long and they had depressing stuff on tv.

I would give this place 4 stars. The place was packed when we went, which means they must be doing something right. the decor was nice and the meals filling. I got a burger with bottomless fries, although I don't recall exactly what. The burger was good and loved the seasoning for the bottomless fries. This is a nice option for burgers when you don't want to rely on fast food.

Pour service from from server and pour service from manager.  waited over 10+ min. for refills had to get up and go to bar to get service, as I walked to the bar from the other side of the restaurant I noticed all the servers in the prep area talking, also notice 4 servers in the bar chatting away and eating.  during this whole time the manager was in the kitchen talking, none of the servers attempted to ask me if I need help, they looked at me and kept going on with there conversations.  The only helpful person was the gentleman attending the bar.  When I brought this to the managers attention he made a bunch of excuses into why the service was so atrocious,  I pointed out that there are servers standing there doing nothing and not looking over the restaurant to see who need assistance.  Then the manager asked me what should he do, as a guest I should not need to explain to a manager what to do, I believe that a manager needs to know how to deal with any situation that comes along.  When I went to pay for my tab the server dropped it on the table and disappeared not to be seen again, and her attitude when dropping it off was very unprofessional and uncalled for.  It was almost like she wanted to be fired.   The worst part is this is an ongoing problem at all the Red Robins I have been to.  I would of given them 0 stars but the food was good.   I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Ordered mozzarella sticks shit wasn't even hot, cheese wasn't even melted, it was like eating breaded string cheese so I returned it also stay away from the microwaved clam chowder absolutely disgusting

So once again not a good experience at Red Robin. lots of upset customers not getting food in a timely manner, and our appetizers the pretzel bites are nasty!!! came half ass cooked and incomplete.Our food came out cold Never again will I visit this Red Robins

Good food and good service as any other Red Robin. Went here after work since I was craving bottomless steak fries, and of course, it hit the spot. As always, I wish they'd give more fries with each serving.

Not bad...place was packed as usual.  Burger and fries was what I expected.  I do like the bottomless fries option and I made sure I took advantage of it.  Red Robin always seems to be a good choice before or after a movie.

I'll just start off with the food was great as always!  Tried the promo Burserker burger and it was deeelicious!  That being said, here's the digs... The greeting/hostess staff at this location were impersonal and every employee that walked in and clocked in for their shift looked like they were going to work at the morgue or something.  We were hardly payed attention to during our waiting for a seat.  This was our first time to this location.  We arrived for lunch at 11:30 and there was a restaurant full of empty tables but for some reason had to wait 10 minutes.  How could this many tables be open without the opportunity to start dining?!  And this wasn't even explained to us while we had to wait.  We sat there confused, frustrated, and almost walked out.  We really wanted Red Robin for lunch and we've always enjoyed RR restaurants and our past experiences at them.  Needless to say, as we were finally getting brought to our table, there was an employee sleeping at the table next to us.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!!!!!!  How unprofessional can you be?  I was pretty upset at this point and mentioned to our waitress how unprofessional that was and she told us that this employee works 2 jobs and that she's tired.  WOW!!!  But she did finally tell the girl and she moved to the other side of the restaurant after she glared at my wife.  Way to go super tired employee, maybe you should sleep in your car so nobody has to actually bring up the fact that you're sleeping in the restaurant that people are eating in!!!  WTF?!!!  I observed the manager throughout our dining experience and he was about as friendly as a fence post.  I've never been to a Red Robin like this.  Usually everyone is upbeat and helpful and respectful.  It just shows that a crappy manager with no excitement doesn't challenge his staff to be at that level either.  It's as if he didn't care about what was going on.  Very sad!  Also, the hostess didn't say anything to us as we walked past her while we were leaving...go figure, this was the champ that reflected the excitement of the manager so I wasn't shocked not hearing, "Have a great day!", or "Thanks for coming in!"  But lastly, our waitress ended up doing a fantastic job, our food was delicious as always, and we were paid attention to throughout the rest of our time there.  I would love to recommend this Red Robin but it needs to be kicked up a notch before I ever go back in there.  First impressions are everything.

The food was good, but the service was not the best. It was busy on a Friday night, but the service still could have been better. My sister & I didn't receive a milkshake and half of an entrée that we ordered until we were more than half way done with the food. Disappointed with my experience.

I had already ate dinner. But I did order dessert. Mint chocolate brownie milkshake is a must try! My husband ordered the portobello mushroom burger. We love the bottomless fries and the bottomless beverages. Our daughter had the chicken breasts with teriyaki sauce and a side of apple slices. Chicken breast was cooked perfectly.  The late night waitress wasn't there when we needed her. I wouldn't recommend dinning in before they close. Other than that, for my 3rd time comming here. I'm still satisfied with their service!

No matter what day of the week, the food and service is always consistently great! By far one of my favorite restaurants in Fresno. Whether at River Park or W. Shaw I have never had a bad food experience at Red Robin. Burgers are cooked to perfection (pink in the middle) and the bottomless fries are bomb! I always get the Whiskey BBQ Burger and add Blue Cheese and spicy ketchup to it! OMG, delicious!! My family loves the atmosphere and food and will definitely continue to eat here religiously

Been here more times than I can count! Always exceptional service and delicious food. Seriously after only 1 or 2 visits some of our servers even remembered us! It's always fun to see what new dessert, bar drink or burger special they are running. And this location allows me to get my to do list done on top it! High recommendation!!

NEW MENU!! I'll say that again NEW MENU!!!  This is the place to go for burgers....and bottomless steak fries....the sauces for the onion rings are so good...and the seasoning for the burgers goes great on the fries... And I'm a sucker for any place that has Sam Adams Octoberfest!! Brings me back to my days in Boston!! Who would have thought a chain restaurant would make such a delicious burger. Located in the large UTC shopping complex, you'll find a Red Robin. Plenty of parking outside,if you don't mind walking, though it can get quite busy fighting for a spot with all the other shoppers.  Walk in and the bar is hidden away to the left by all the TV's and plenty of seating (I don't think I have ever had to wait for a table here) To the back is the kitchen with glass front that allows you to see the cooks working hard... or is it hardly working!!  Seriously though the new menu is awesome! Spicy Thai sauce and ranch on the basket of fries is a big reason why we love you Red Robin!! I get the Royal Red Robin Burger and I am continually impressed! Although over the years the serving size of fries they give you for the "bottomless" fries has gotten smaller, its bottomless, so we still get our fix!! Chicken salads are huge and the Caesar  wraps on funky green tortillas are bomb too!  Great job Red Robin for not dropping the ball after over 10 yrs! Although I still have hard feelings for you closing down locations in North County as I have to drive from Carlsbad and this is the closest location. We need Red Robin in NORTH COUNTY!!!

Modified this review from 3 stars to 2. As the service continues to deteriorate, so should business. Unfortunately, patrons will continue to have a hankering for quality gourmet burgers, and will continue to b*tch about the expected lag in service, whether by waiters or the kitchen. As we have just done. Gotta have me a Royal Red Robin or Hunka Hunka Burnin' Love burger.

Took a couple of friends and their kids from out of town here for a farewell lunch before they had to get on the road and wow did we get some bad service. The place was very empty with maybe five tables having people eating at them and we were seated very quickly but that was the best part of the meal. The waitress took our orders and walked away and we waited and waited till finally my friends asked me if this is how all service is in California. I told them no and tried to explain that they were probably understaffed. But that didn't work when my friends wife pointed out the four staff members in the corner   with the manager. After waiting almost an hour for our food to arrive cold we asked for some extra napkins, a refill on our drinks, and some sides and plates for our kids to which the waitress replied of course. But yet again nothing was brought to our table even after reminding her twice.  I love red robin and I cannot believe the service we received. I was so embarrassed that the last meal I had with friends of mine I have not seen in 10 years and probable wont get to see again for awhile was so bad. I will not go back to this location.

My partner and I always go out to eat and one of the things we always pay close attention to is the customer service. Lately we've been on this Red Robin kick and have been going to different Red Robins from Fresno to Visailia. Our waitress Dana has exceptional customer service and is very attentive and informative friendly and inviting. I'm so impressed with the service here I thought I'd be able to finish this before anything got here but I already have my margarita and my appetizers. I can't enough how satisfied I am with the service here. I myself work in customer service and it's so important to have the qualities and personality friendliness and be informative like Dana. I hope that your manager takes a moment to read this and show you some recondition. Hard work should never go unnoticed.
Always been a great place to eat. Always packed. Had the black pepper bacon burger, it was fantastic. Fair prices, good food, good location and good service.

Wow, I was pleasantly surprised with my most recent trip to this Red Robin. I stopped going to one of the other Red Robins because the food and service was terrible. I visited here tonight and the service was great and the food was good. I got the simply grilled chicken salad. Couldn't have asked for anything more for the price. Also, we were seated right away. Food came out a little slow but I wasn't in a hurry. Our waitress was great. Overall, I would be back to visit THIS Red Robin over the others in the Fresno/Clovis area. It is still a chain restaurant but decent for what it is.
The food is sub-par at this location. The service never ceases to be awful. Our server never refilled anything, made us wait for a very long time, and had an unkempt and unprofessional appearance.

On the positive  side, they have Newcastle on tap and their fish 'n chips are really good. The service is average. The carpet either needs a serious cleaning or it needs to be replaced. On the negative side, it seems to be standard policy here to serve old, stale fries that have been marinating under a heat lamp, with your meal.  But when you ask for fresh fries they gladly bring you some. So note to management if you're reading this, Make your fries fresh and serve them to your customers without them having to ask for them and work on your cleanliness (SSOP). They don't have Newcastle on tap anymore.

Cool looking place. But that was the highlight. My burger wasn't hot or juicy and I didn't like the bread (bun). Just not feelin' them... My fries weren't that great either. I want to believe but my taste buds slapped my brain out of it pretty fast. Like a divining rod leading to a precious resource, mine kicked into reverse and started pointing away from my location and toward Colorado grill and In and Out. Disappointed with my meal here. -G
they don't have Red Robins in Louisiana so i had to stop by when I was in Fresno. it is always a good hamburger. whenever I see one I will usually stop by unless i see something local

Wow oh wow, as good as red robin can be, what a horrible experience we had two evenings ago.  We got there at about 745-8pm, as we waited for a few others to join us. We waited about 7-8 minutes for a server to come to our table to get out drinks going, (and that was from one server) next, 8 minutes later, I finally got my freckled lemonade, (from a different server), 9 minutes later, (a third server came to our table) and had asked if we wanted any appetizers, yet, he did not even take our order, he said he will send our server over to our table, (which we were unsure of who our server was since we had so many people come to us.) 6 minutes later, a woman named jasmine who was our server came to take our appetizers order. Our guests got there, & waited for her for at least 10 minutes to come to grab their drinks. As one of our guests ordered a freckled lemonade, it looked like water & tasted nothing like my drink. So, we waited to try to grab her to tell her he just wanted a water, still no where to be around or found, so we grabbed the manager to get it for us. We then placed our orders, I ordered the whiskey river BBQ salad, and my father did as well. Didn't take too long at all for our food, that was the good part. She brought us our food, and I received a salad and my father received a burger, which was not what we ordered. The manager then fixed that for us and apologized, fixed his order, and told us our server will not be back that he will be taking care of us for the rest of the evening. (Whoo! He was awesome!) she later came back, and after everyone was half way done eating, my father and I did not even start yet, because I asked for a fork for us to eat our salads with and she eventually brought us one. Asked for extra napkins and utensils, she brings us one napkin and a bunch of knives, (she could have at least brought us some scissors so we could cut the napkin into 5 pieces.) we were all very disappointed at this time, the manager took over, & we had eaten. The waitress had the brought us boxes, (which I really didn't want to even take my food home it was so bad.) and she said, "I'm not sure what the problem here was or what I did wrong, but my manager took 46$ off of your bill for whatever reason that was." I was in awe that a server would say that to a customer. I, myself, am a server, and would not EVER say that to a customer. Ever. Extremely rude! I will not be back, to that location at least, and if for some reason I do return, I will not have her as our server again.

My family and I absolutely love red robin! This location to say the least is always disappointing! The service is not that great. we've been back to this location about 3 times (why? i dont know) and every time our food is cold!! and the shakes are watery! and the carpet needs a good cleaning

Very disappointing.  Never provided us with napkins or utensils and I had to ask for them when the server brought the food.  Ten minutes later we got forks, knives and napkins as our food got cold.  Also never brought us my son's drink.  Again, had to ask for it and got attitude from the server like I was being unreasonable.  Ordered the guacamole bacon burger which was very small and had virtually no guacamole.  Not going back.  Way overpriced and bad service.
We had the Nantucket seafood scatter it was outstanding! The service here is always friendly! We also had the mini wedge salad! Delicious! Can't wait to have it again!

I visited the place today with a few friends.  This was my first time.  The waitress was pleasant enough and my burger was okay.  The bottom less drink wasn't bottomless as I never got a refill.  The bottomless fries also never arrived.  The original serving of fries was rather small, but I figured, it's okay since they'll bring more.   I guess I was wrong.  Every time we asked the waitress, she said some other server was taking all the fries and they were making more.  After about 45 minutes, we gave up.

We've been here before. Red Robin is not a mystery great burgers, fries and other dishes   A step up from your typical grill. But what sets this eatery apart from the others is thee awesome service. We'll go here rather than take a chance. Some upper end restaurants provide a low end service experience that ruins the evening. If you like good food good atmosphere, and being treated well, try the place that brings you back. Ian was our server and he's a rock star! If you get him you're guaranteed to enjoy.
Whiskey River BBQ burger is my fave.  Wished they don't have the caffeinated Barf root beer from Coke.

Walked in about an hour ago.  There was a party of 5 before me. They were greeted & seated.  There were three girls in front.  I did not receive a greeting.  I waiting a few and nothing.  In annoyance I cleared my throat and one of the gals finally turned to me and said sorry how many?  I told her 2 and told her I greatly appreciated the fact that I was not acknowledged.  She sits us in the bar section and our waiter starts off good.  I ordered a blue ribbon burger on wheat.  I finished my beverage.....no refill.  My burger came out on a white bun and my fries were cold.  Worst food ever consumed at any Red Robins ever.

We were seated near the restroom area. The hostess didn't seem too happy to move us when we requested. The order took forever to get to us and once we got it, the food was COLD! Glad the manager was gracious to us, but we have decided not to come back to this location again.
Its not like ti use to be and miss the one at Manchester... but love the the fries

Loving their new menu selection and the fresh jalapeños and ghost pepper sauce options.  It took us 35 minutes to get our meals on a Saturday at lunch but I think we just hit it at the wrong time.  Try the pumpkin spice milkshake, but make sure you don't go it alone, we shared it with four of us.
Zero stars. cold food, service took forever, and once we had our food our servers abandoned us. a waste of a night from a restaurant i used to love coming to. Such a disappointment.

Okay where to begin....finally I walked in and was immediately greeted with a friendly smile and asked whether we wanted a booth or table - this is important!  I hate having to sit at a table when there are tons of booths available.  We sat down and were told that our waitress would be Deidra.  She was phenomenal!  Very attentive, very customer driven.  My cousin and I ordered Guacamole Burgers but instead of guacamole we asked for avocados with garlic fries.....apparently Red Robin has changed the way they make garlic fries. We were disappointed and let Deidra know.  Instead of brushing us off she brought us out fresh garlic fries made "old school" style and told us that her goal was to please the customer and give us a great experience!   Thank you Deidra!  By far the best service I've ever had aT RR.  Btw.....Burgers were great and so were the fries.

Rachel Ray is the Queen of Burgers. Michael Simon is the Guru of burgers. I'm not an expert chef like them but I have been deemed the pharaoh of burgers. I know how to expertly craft every burger I make. I do this so incredibly, that I can actually make a veggie burger taste exquisite.       Red Robin Gourmet Burgers. I loved this restaurant. Yes, that was past tense. The last handful of times I went their I had been disappointed time and time again. Burgers made for a manly man were tiny and tasteless. I have gone from the bottom of the barrel like McDonalds. To the best in fast food, like Rally's, Carl's Jr, and In and Out. They all trump Red Robins. Every time I was so disappointed in these baby size tasteless little burgers that I was spending upwards if $12 dollars on that I didn't even finish them. Never before in my life had I not finished any burger.       If you have money to burn, don't have taste buds, want to have thoughts of becoming a vegan, or like non quality burgers from a burger joint of all things! Well, then this is the place for you. I highly recommend steering clear of this place but if you and your friends or family are deciding, and you get out voted. And you have to go to Red Robin. Then I suggest you get something, aside from one of their burgers.

Yea... Years ago I would have rated this place 5 stars, but over the last few visits their customer service has dropped down immensely. I am all about customer service, but if it takes 20 for our drinks to come out, 40 minutes for our appetizers and then 1.5 hours for our diner & the people who sat down after us gets their food before us Oh... And the order was wrong. Yea that calls for no starts if possible. They gave me a $20 but that isn't going to fix the customer service issue...i rather have that fixed than money.

This restaurant chain has really changed it way of making food. Hamburgers are not back great anymore and fries or not steak fry size anymore. Instead you get these shoe string fries which is not appealing anymore. Red robin in my opinion is starting to go downhill.

I went a few days ago with a friend for lunch and I had a great experience. I haven't been in a few years but the food was great, not cold, and served right away. The manager walked the floor to make sure everyone was fine. My server was nice and friendly. The only thing i didn't care for was the crying kid in the booth next to me. They have all you can eat fries but now they serve them in smaller portions and i like that. I don't feel bad for wasting if i get full
One of the best staffs and good food. They have everything quick and clean. However their bathrooms are really small but other than that perfect place to grab a bit no matter the occasion.

Worst service EVER. Drinks not refilled,slow service, food over cooked if you ask how the burger should be prepared, your cooks should've able to pull it off. $5.00 for s strawberry lemonade that was never refilled.  We shouldn't have to ask for everything. Services should be offered or suggested.  It's a good thing my kids love it so much or it would have been 1 star. ALSO, PET PEEVE....carpet in a restaurant! It is filthy and needs to be retired.

Not as good as used to be. The garlic fries are a joke. They charge a dollar extra for them and all you get is basic fries with garlic salt. Service was horrible. I'm to the point of why bother anymore. Not worth it

Sigh, oh Red Robin.  I love your burgers so much.  Saturday your service was better than normal and the waitress got a great tip.  Now, in the past i have left a bad review because, like others have said the service is not so good.  This last Saturday the service was good, my burger was tasty and my wife got sick.  Now, I'm not accusing Red Robin of food poisoning my wife, as I have no proof.  However, after eating the chicken, she threw up all day yesterday and nauseated and recovering today.

This place used to be a lot better between 2005-2010. Since then there has been a lot of turnover because not even the employees want to be there any more. The service is incredibly slow and nonexistent at times throughout the meal. The manager wants to blame things on the server when clearly there is not enough staff to cover all the tables. To me, unlimited fries and refills means unlimited. When the server is barely ever coming to the table, then I have to go the whole meal with out refilled drink and fries. When ordering, if ordering gets too specific, be prepared to receive attitude from the servers, because like I said previously, they are already understaffed. I miss the days when servers were like friends, the food was delicious, the refills came as soon as they needed to be there, and you got more than five fries as a refill. Hopefully it improves. I am sad to say, this is no longer my favorite casual restaurant in Fresno.

Very disappointing.     We had to ask our server when our food would be ready.  She kept telling us that we would have it in "one more minute."   As we sat waiting, we observed several servers texting on their cellphones, and another on talking on his cellphone.  Thirty-five minutes later we finally got our food.  My veggie burger was mediocre at best.  The little side salad was ok.  My husband's burger was good. We will not be back.

I took the family this Red Robin near Riverpark for the first time in several years due to multiple bad meals in a row.  This time it was different.  Great burgers, inexpensive prices, good service and I liked the system of texting wait time status.  They are remodeling a bit for the better.
Terrible service! Our food was served cold and took forever to be taken to our table... the restaurant wasnt busy or anything... completely understaffed!

My wife recently posted a review documenting the poor service tendered during recent visits to this establishment. I wanted to take the time to document the efforts made by management towards maintaining our patronage. Unlike years ago, it is now a rarity where precious time is reallocated to appease the expressed disdain of individual customers. I applaud the demonstrated labors of this restaurant towards ensuring the satisfaction of every customer that walks through the door. Admissions of temporary ineptitude and apologies sodden in sincerity have gone a long way towards the rectification of this issue. This dedication has prompted us to give this restaurant a well-deserved second chance, and we implore you to do the same. After all, the burgers, fries, and cold beers have always been on point, and the passion for customer satisfaction demonstrated by management makes me believe the people responsible for serving you these delicacies are sure to procure the customer service skills required to ensure indifferences such as these are a part of their past.

Will not be back to this location for a LONG time. Today we came here for lunch and we saw our waitress twice during our visit....once when she brought us our silverware/napkins and again when she brought us the check.  Other than that she was absent....in fact I'm not ever sure I should say she was our waitress.  The hostess ended up being the one to get our drinks and take our order.  She also brought out our food too.  The appetizer arrived at our table about 2 minutes before out entrees.  Other than the fries being soggy and undercooked (and hardly any if them) the food itself was decent.  Had it not been for the hostess doing all of the work, we would have definitely walked out.  Worst service I have had at a restaurant in a very long time.

My husband and I have just been there. Tasty onion rings, great burgers (Tavern & Royal). Daniel was very careful and super nice. He came to our table many times to check if we needed anything else. Beverages were also very good. Affordable prices, very good quality and great ambience! We will definitely come back to this place!

The burgers are great but the bottomless fries take forever! Our waitress was slow but probably because she had too many tables. You would think the manager would help her out but no he was just there standing and looking around.

Our server was great.  I had a bowl of clam chowder and probably will never order it again.  For 5.99 it was suppose to come with garlic toast however it was more like a crouton.  The soup was the size of a cup of soup.  It was a complete rip off.
Great food and great service. Tons of burger options. Great milkshakes. Hard to find a place that the whole family likes and this is it. Can not believe we have not been before.
I ordered a grilled cheese and it came with the end piece of bread, The piece of bread nobody wants. I was I little bit offended by that. Otherwise, great place. Poppyseed sauce is amazing.

The ran out of bigger Hamburger patties on a Friday night and it was early too! So they gave us two smaller patties and took a $1 off our burgers. Very much appreciated. The bottles fries would of been great if our waitress would of come around more . She was there lots before our food came but as soon as the food came she disappeared. It's going to be a while before we go back. And hopefully we never get that waitress again

Very disappointing experience here at the River Park location. The Gourmet Burgers looked nothing like the menu. The service was slow and the so called "Gourmet" burgers were a big disappoint! They were small, served lukewarm, like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp. I ordered the sweet potato fries and even THEY were lukewarm. I had to send MY burger back because it was uncooked in the center. They brought me more fries while I waited and those fries were fresh, hot and delicious. The bad part was they took FOREVER to bring my burger and by the time they did, all my friends were finished with their meals. The quality and portion size were NOT worth the BIG price tag. Won't be back. :=(

I gave this place a 3 star review not because of the food, but because we only had one visit to our table. Nobody asked me if I wanted a refill or if I needed anything. Great in the beginning and were quick to collect my money but failed in between.

This place just got renovated. It looks a lot better. But the service is terrible. It took over an hour to just get an appetizer.  And when everyone's food came out. It was not even hot.  I won't be coming back here at all.  Very disappointed in the service and food.

They've updated their look but not their service! Kids can not eat in the bar area even at the tables which they have been able to for the last 5 years we've been going. One waitress says yes it's fine one says no it's not okay. No one knows any of the "new rules"
Service is awesome and the staff is great, food kinda sucks though. I keep going and I hope it's gonna be tasty, but it still just kinda sucks.

A few coworkers and I come to this RR when we need a quick bite and a cold beer. You cannot get a better burger than the Royal. To sum up, it's juicy deliciousness with egg n bacon to boot. Hmmmm. One of the best burgers out! Try it.  They recently remodeled the interior so it looks like a brand new restaurant inside. It's located near riverpark so the location is perfect. Join their loyalty program and you get free burgers on your bday, a 10th burg free and random other discounts periodically. It's worth it.  Just sit in the bar area and avoid the kids
The service is terrible. Apparently the grilled cheese sandwich I have always ordered and at many red robin locations is now against the rules. They upgraded the look but downgraded the service.

So I came here the other day and I am regular here and I was quite sad about my service here and I love this location and I'm always happy after I leave but not this time. Our waitress never took our orders or our drinks someone else did so by that time she did not get a good tip. But when I got my food I was even more upset because my sandwich had no lettuce at all it only had like literally 3 slices and my mom's had a handful and I was really sad. The only thing I was happy about was when the waitress kept bringing fries so that was a plus. The last thing I was upset about was that she had asked if we needed refills and she was saying it to my dad and I said sure, she looked at me like I was crazy because my glass had a quarter of water left and I was like geez didn't need to give me that look but she still brought me one. I just hope this waitress get better over time because I would really hate to come back have bad service and not come here anymore because this is my all time favorite location out of all of them.

Tonight's service started good but went downhill quick. Our initial waitress was very attentive and her covering waitress wasn't at all! I waited about 20 minutes for a new soda, the person I was with waited 25 minutes for freaking French fries, and when she asked for a side of BBQ sauce, well she never got it. Highly disappointed and when we brought it up to the manager, he did apologize and gave us free dessert but that in itself was just as bad as the service.. This has been dubbed as our WORST experience at Red Robin and at a restaurant in general.

Had an Angus burger, very disappointed.   What was served did not look anything liked pictured in the menu.  Over priced too.... $14.50 for an ordinary burger that was supposed to be sensational.  The French fries were the best part of the meal.

Service was almost on-point on Saturday for party of 10... 4 Star quality... for what they do. Knives, forks and napkins preset in a pile in middle of table... not enough knives, they did bring more on request. Brought several drink refills! Did well on taking orders. Came back and had to confirm several orders... but, that's better than bringing wrong food! Were quick on refilling bottomless fries... a basket or to were served cold, but were quickly replaced. Our only complaint... the touch screens on-the-table pay system!!!! I understand separate checks can be a hassle... but, the screens are on every table.  It felt very 'bag-your-own-groceries' friendly... which doesn't feel friendly at all! And, why they received only 3 Stars from me. (Frown-y face!) Oh, yeah, the food... their burgers are always above average!  I liked that I could choose what type of bun I wanted! And, variety of sauces! Definitely 4 Stars, if not for the touch screen payment system...

We love red robin but even with the recent remodel it's gone downhill.  Wasn't busy and we still Waited forever and there is nowhere to wait except outside in the cold!  Messed up order, food was cold, had to ask numerous times for help, soda was flat...

Once again Red Robin disappoints. I was really hoping for a better experience since my last visit, but every time we've dined here, it seems understaffed and we usually have to wait a long time before our food comes out. It didn't seem to be all that busy tonight, yet it took them at least 25 minutes to buss the table across from us that was empty since before we sat down. My husband's fish sandwich was tasty, but I can't say the same for what I got. I ordered the soup and salad combo, and although my clam chowder was good, I cannot say the same about my salad. It had a funky taste to it, like it had been sitting in the refrigerator all day. Not fresh at all! I didn't send it back because we had already waited so long for our food and being that we had our two young daughter's with us, it was any minute before they got anxious, so I just ate it anyway. Well, BIG mistake. I ended up having a really bad stomachache when I got home and then throwing up a few hours later. I won't bother to call and complain, because based on everyone else's reviews, it doesn't seem like they care too much about their quality of food or service like they did in the past. Red Robin has gone down the drain and unfortunately we will not be coming back.
It's a Red Robin, nothing too special Came for Veteran's day to get a free burger-so I can't complain and free food always tastes better.

We ordered the buzzard wings and chili con queso along with burgers and the food was top notch. We had great service, the waitress was attentive and got our food to us in a timely manner. Would recommend this location to everyone!

I didnt really feel anything special at this place for a first time. Their food was good. And our server was very friendly and attentive. The waiting time to get seated, get our server, and food were also mannerly. One thing i would complain about is the touch screen/tablet our table kinda felt so dirty. I can see some grease on it.

This  place is bomb! All the burgers are big, you can get bottomless fries and lots of ranch. They have their own seasoning which is amazing too. You can get all kinds of cool drinks and salads here; they literally have everything. It's an open setting with tons of TV's and a full bar in the back left. I usually get Dr. Pepper and bottomless fries to start, and get a chicken wrap with a couple of sides of ranch that I sprinkle their seasoning on top. I always have to take a box of extras home. 5/5 great all around restaurant.

Waited over an hour for our food.  It's been 20 minutes now and we are still waiting for our dessert order.  No one has cleared our dinner plates yet.  Dinner was good though.  The mess on the bar next to us is still here from when we pulled up to the bar.    The bar tender is completely by herself on a busy Saturday night.   She is good and very friendly but she should at least have a bar back to help.   Very Poorly managed tonight.

Came here for the first time. The service was great. They have gluten free burger buns which is awesome and the refills on fries is cool. But the bacon cheese burger was meh. I was surprised to see how small the burger was when it arrived. The burger looked and tasted like something you would expect to get in a Happy Meal LOL. The minuscule amount of meat tastes like low grade meat. If it weren't for the refill on the fries I would have left very hungry. The burger was flavorless and the meat was dry. I don't think I will be returning to another Red Robin.

Service here is lousy. It took almost 20 mins just to get drinks on an occasion. The food is tasty, but it's so busy for the crew to keep up. The floors are usually a mess every time I show up. Usually go here if I'm invited, but otherwise I'd drive to the one on Shaw. Much more cleaner, and fast service.

I'll start by saying that based solely on the food, Red Robin is one of my favorite restaurants ever. But this place has TERRIBLE service. My biggest gripe is with the amount and frequency of their "Bottomless fries". They give you maybe 10 steak fries at a time, and when you ask for more, it takes about 10 minutes before they bring them to you. So in all reality, you're looking at maybe 20 fries during your whole meal. They also seem to have the same policy about refills (ever on water). I suspect this is a dirty money-saving tactic. It's sad because I would probably come here a couple times a month if they had good service. As it is, I go there maybe twice a year, when I'm not hungry enough to care.

Service was just ok but my meal was gross. I ordered the Nantucket clucket seafood sampler and fish had no flavor, coke slaw was sour and fries were soggy.  Shrimp was ok I guess. I would not recommend this meal.  My friend had a burger and fries and complained about her fries but her burger was fine.  Oh and I was charged for garlic fries but they weren't garlic fries from what I could see.  Like I said they were soggy. Whose bright idea was it to put fries on top of coke slaw.  Just not a smart move. Get it together red robin....

Very disappointing service, fries were cold when we got our food, only got 1 refill on my bottomless drink, was thirsty for the rest of my meal because our waiter didn't show up until she gave us our check -_- I remember this being way better quality!

Slooooow service.  Waited 30 minutes for 2 burgers and a kid meal.  French fries were cold.  Burger was tasteless.  Took 10 minutes to get my card back.   100 places in Fresno with better ( and cheaper ) burgers.  Try anywhere!
Good food. Good drinks. Only issue their fries here are a hit or miss. Some days I couldn't stop eating them other days it was soggy.

Oh my, I'm really overdue to write this review. This place will always have a special place in my heart because the food is first fantastic as well as the waitress & waiter's are so tentative & the vibe really make me feel special without paying a arm or a leg. Really you can get a great meal at a great price. I'm a teriyaki chicken burger Lover and the bottomless fries make me a happy camper I'm in heaven. So just Imagine that sweet teriyaki sauce dripping from a Fat chicken sandwich with nice round pineapple savoring you with that Fab smell, it coming down your way & it fabulous. The wait is just right not to fast & not to slow it the perfect place to take your family then grab a couple movies on the way home.

My son took me there for my birthday so I guess it sums it up we like to celebrate at this place. Food is always good and the staff is really exceptional at their jobs. Don't be afraid to ask if they can accomidate your dite they will do their best.

I can't even give this location even one star.   We put our name in for a table for 7 and were told it would be 15-20 minute wait.   After 1 hour we were told there was still no table.   We ended up leaving.   Sorry!!! Not willing to be left worrying that long!!!

Really really great food, atmosphere is great, tv's everywhere, milkshake are amazing, got a burger so so good. Service was on point, only complaint is my appatizer came then very soon after my burger came.please let me finish that first. Get over here and enjoy you won't be disappointed.

I've come here plenty of times and it's just my luck that almost every single time I've been here, someone forgets to put my order through or they "lose" my ticket. I understand people make mistakes but what're the odds that it happens almost every time I get there. I've been patient each time and haven't made a fuss but today was the last straw. Eat here if you want to get your food an hour later or not at all.

So..... I guess we don't come here for great food so expectations are pretty low. The food met these just fine.  We were sat next to the waiters station where they get drinks etc, and our service was atrocious. Missed requests that took a long time. We knew they were not busy as they were all hanging out talking and gossiping - not getting a drink refill like we asked etc.  Blah food is just fine when that is not your goal, bad service never is.

I would give this place zero stars if that was an option. Super slow service. Waited 20 minutes for more water and fries. Took a long time to get seated even though there were many open tables. Other customers around us had problems as well.
I always love the burgers at Red Robin.  The smoke and pepper is my favorite.  I can't seem to try any of the others since I've been 'hooked' on this one.

Had the AvoCobbO salad. Was delicious and the chicken was flavored and grilled to perfection. Our waitress kaela was friendly and personable. Would definitely go back. The only thing I didn't like was being charged $1.99 for entertainment fee for playing a game on the table side tablet. I didn't see where that was pre posted but I could have missed it.

I have a love hate relationship with RR I like the burger fries and etc how ever I have issues with portion size but I respect that most of their offerings are at around $10 mark........ However and that's a large HOWEVER if it weren't for the bottomless fries you will go away hungry without an appetizer. I'm 6'-5" 300 and I understand if you are 5'-4" and wear uggs you will be fine with the portion size but I'm a man with an appetite. The once mightily sized burgers that could curb the appetite of any respectable XXL man or bigger are long gone but at least you can play with the annoying tablets at every table now!

It's been a while since I have came to Red Robin's and I noticed that this location has changed their decorations and floorplan. I got the BLTA Croissant with a cup of Chicken Tortilla Soup along with their famous Strawberry Lemonade. I noticed that their side portions are a lot smaller now compared to 5 years ago. The cup of soup is super small and was basically 5 soup spoonfuls. The BLTA Croissant didn't settle well in my stomach that night. Strawberry Lemonade was good the first time around, but the refills they were stingy on the strawberries. This place used to be one of my go to, but after tonight, I think I will have to skip.

My husband and I come here more than I care to admit! You know what you're getting here, it's easy, it's casual, and it's pretty cheap.  For starters we usually go for a combo of zucchini fries and mozzarella sticks - all the healthy stuff, right?! Then for mains I usually switch it up. The crispy chicken burger is good, always really crispy as advertised, hot, a generous sized piece of meat. The bun doesn't fall apart, and it's pretty filling. The whisky river chicken burger is good too. I sometimes go for a salad or the whisky river chicken wrap for something a bit lighter. Fries are bottomless, so they give you a smaller portion than they used to but will always bring more if you ask. My husband's a fan of the burnin' love burger. The menu is really extensive but the burgers are definitely the highlight. The bar has good options, several beers on tap, and a decent selection of liquors (including more than 2 kinds of gin, which I appreciate!). There are a ton of sugary cocktails on offer, though not my scene. I can't recommend its wine selection, though they do have a sangria thing that does the job if you want to walk the line between wine and booze. The milkshakes are really good, and they'll give you the leftovers in a silver cup along with the main event which is perfect for sharing. It's not gonna blow your socks off, but if you want some burgers and fries and a drink you probably won't walk away disappointed.

I came here with my aunt I order appetizers spinach dip and the nachos dip. Was good probably the best out of everything I then ordered carne asada fries to which they told me they can make..The lady comes back with fries and cut up dry hamburger patty? Mixed in instead of steak? I was super confused I didn't eat it. And then they messed up both my aunts and mines milk shake. Service was slow and I had to go up to the bar to get my bill because no one came to us. The appetizers were the only thing worth it

I haven't been to a Red Robin in at least 10 years. I used to love the fish-n-chips, but they are not what I remembered. Everything was as I remembered except the food. The service was good, the restaurant was clean but the food was not that great. The fish was okay, not great, but the fries seemed old. We asked for fresh fries and they were a little better...they were warm which was a plus, but they tasted like they were made from old potatoes. Just an odd flavor. It will probably be another 10 years before I come back.

These people have the worst service. If you make a call ahead(which doesn't do DK), they say they will write it down but they don't. On top of that I know am waiting an hour and a half. So not worth it. No one knows what going on. Every single time. There is always a wait with open tables. Place sucks. Would not recommend or go back.

They are very expensive burgers (one is around $14) but they are good and coupons can really help. The various drinks and sweet potato fries are all tasty. The service at various sites is usually friendly and efficient.

Very kid friendly restaurant love the food love the burgers very nice staff patient with the kids sometimes if it takes a long time to come out but it's OK will wait and it's always busy you know it's a good restaurant when it's always busy

Pretty darn good.  They cleaned up their spot and it's much nicer. We like to sit at the bar, it's quicker. I love the whiskey river BBQ burger.  Pro tip- join their rewards clubs. They give good rewards and you can get free burgers!!

Deciding what to eat is pretty hard here in The "Central Valley" because the chains here is either a hit or a miss or a big disappointment. So I gave Red Robin and shot and it wasn't that bad but it seems you have to wait almost an eternity for your burger. I had the following today Big Tavern Burger 4/5 taste pretty good but it took them awhile to make my single patty burger Short order onions rings 3/5 so it's basically almost $1.00 for each onion rings nice taste and crunch but kinda oily  Steak fries 3/5 found hair on my fries but it didn't stop me from eating part of them they claim they use north western potatoes but I couldn't find anything special or anything stands out Service 4/5 my server kept on refilling my drink which was a good thing Freckle lemonade 2/5 basically your minute made from the soda fountain with strawberries, it was watered down  Red Robin is good place for getting burgers and steak fries but I still prefer Ruth Chris or Flemings during their happy hour. The only thing that was kinda irritating was waiting for the burger it them longer than usual for a single "big patty" Tavern burger while the place was not packed at all. So for $20.00 without adding my server the $6.00 tip Red Robin makes good burgers and it doesn't cost you and arm and leg to eat here just the waiting makes you wonder should you come back Next time?

We came as a group of 8.  The restaurant was clean and ample parking.  The waitress we had was too busy to really help us or be personable.  We all ordered different fries and tried the garlic fries and regular fries.  We all received the 1st round of fries and they were definitely not hot.  The next round were not hot.  One of the 8 of us expressed a wish to have the fries be hot.  His were hot.  So disappointing.  The burgers were good but not that great.  I definitely expected more from this restaurant.  We were a group of seniors.  All of us ordered drinks.  It was about 3:30 or 4.  I asked about the drinks available during Happy Hour.  The waitress responded like she didn't really know and was too busy to help us.  I just ordered a Blue Moon.  It was full price.  No one got any discount on their drinks.  Thank you waitress that was too busy.  The restaurant was not very busy.  I would not recommend Red Robin in Fresno to my Family and Friends and would not go back myself.  In and Out offers better burgers and are a whole lot friendlier.

Always our go to Burger joint.  Great food great service always a fan. Me and mom always have our lunch dates here.  I always like to try something different every time we come here.  And we are never disappointed.

They were way better! Service was too slow, you have to wait long time for the waitress to come back and check on you. Basically you have to press the call waitress button to get any attention. They try to ignore you so you do not ask for more fries and when they bring the fries they are 6-8 pieces! They brought the wrong order for my son and we all started eating and when he got his right order we were all done eating and he was full from eating french fries! We got our orders after 50-60 min (3 burgers and kids chicken fingers!). They did not offer to take off my son order... I think corporate needs to check on their branches more often.

Good news. Both burgers were really good. Bad news.......the whole reason we stopped coming here was that they couldn't figure out how to bring me hot French fries.  And like to say they've fixed it.....NOPE.  Jesus Christ!!!  If the fries are cold don't bring them!!! First ones on the side of my burger:  COLD Reorder:  eh....warm.  Finish those (they only brought like....5 fries) and order another. They get crossed and bring two orders.  BOTH COLD.  Reorder...... Another two batches. Another two sets of room temp fries.  I give up.  Tapping out.

We had a great dinner Monday night. Food was good as usual. She had the tortilla soup, and it was all gone, didn't share with me. But I remember it being very good, still must be. I had the chop house burger this time instead of my usual bonsai burger, and I was glad I tried this. Mushrooms, grilled onion crisp, tasty burger, onion bun. It's salty but good. There usually fluffy meaty steak burgers came a bit too done this time, but fries are not consistent anywhere so it must have been the batch. I could have, should have asked for a new bunch but I was so full from my burger. New for me was the Italian soda. A bit too sweet, but still ok. If you have not been in awhile they have made some changes, and still getting used to. Also $75 with tip for family of 4 for a burger joint is steep. We ate for a less at Colorado Grill, which is just as tasty. Sorry Red but you are not going to get frequent visits at those prices. Find a way to be more economical and I'll come back more often

Great place to drop in and grab a burger and fries....or in my case a chicken burger and fries. I don't know if it's just because I was one of the first customers of the day but I was treated awesomely and the food was the best it's ever been. Whatever the case may be, everything was on point today. I didn't even mind paying the $1.99 entertainment fee to play some games with my son.  My California chicken burger was cooked to perfection. The bacon was crispy, the avocado was fresh and ripe, the cheese was melty .... yum. I also upgraded to garlic fries which were also amazing! My son had the pizza and it looked tasty.  My server was nice. She had a great attitude and had a positive vibe about her. I like visits like these. Where you leave so fully satisfied!

After a terrible experience at a different location, I decided to give this establishment another chance and I'm so glad I did. Long story short, Amanda is a phenomenal server. She not only recommended appetizers and drinks but delivered efficient customer service with a positive attitude throughout my visit. I'll definitely be back!

Our meal tonight was horrendous! Half our table got their meal 30 minutes late and the staff was not apologetic! When we finally got a manager she claimed that she would discount our whole tables meal. She only discounted one of the meals and barely at that! Then offered the whole table free dessert that never came, once we asked the manager about said free dessert we finally got the dessert that was donuts that tasted like onion rings. They were disgusting! This was the worst Mother's Day meal and we will NEVER be back!

Have always been a fan until today!  Told us the wait for the bar area would be 5-10 minutes, after 20 minutes checked with hostess only to find they didn't have our name on the list. Finally seated in too small of a table only to be told their draft beer wasn't working!  The server was nice and informed us the hostess stand was supposed to be advising customers  but obviously wasn't. We left and won't be back.

The service was good for the most part. The guy was friendly and attentive. I know my dad hated the fact that he kept pushing him to use the table tablet. Lol. Mozzarella sticks for appetizers. They were really good. My dad and boyfriend ordered salads. They seemed to like it. They didn't say anything bad about it, which is good I guess? I'm fat/pregnant so I got the ghost pepper burger thing with the endless fries. I expected the burger to be spicier. I was surprised by how many jalapeños they put on this thing though. They put some on the bottom bun, in between the 2 patties, and on top. Putting 20 jalapeños on something isn't going to make it any spicier. It's just going to taste like jalapeño.  Like, I wanted this burger with some jalapeño. But it's like I got jalapeños, with some burger. Lol. Regardless, after picking off half of them, it was a good burger. The fries were okay.   Overall okay experience.

Service was okay Burgers are always good as well as the fries I suggest asking for the fries to come out as soon as they are ready  Water at this location always taste funny to me And sadly they are getting rid of my favorite burger the dgb but they still have tons of great stuff on the menu They re did this location and it looks much nicer now

The food was good. But, I was charged $1.99 for an "Entertainment fee" because it was my Granddaughter's Birthday and the servers sang to her. If I would have been asked, I would have said no. Very disappointed in RR for this.
Red Robin's burgers are always amazing. It gets busy but my server was on it. Pretty much the same experience every RR you go to.
Bottomless fries lol takes forever to just get refill still waiting my god are they peeling the potatoes,lol

We came here on a whim and wow, we would never return. Our server was great she was upbeat and very nice. She was able to handle multiple tasks asked of her not only by us but everyone in her her area. We were seated near the kitchen, which was fine.  As I sat watching the people in the kitchen I was shocked!! The food runners were touching the food (yes with bare dirty hands)looking at what kind of burgers were on the plates so they could take them to the appropriate tables, one of the ladies actually took food from a silver bin that the kitchen staff slide thru the pass Thru, it look like chicken strips to me? Picked them up by her bare hands and put it on someone's plate! I was shocked at all the mishandling of food at this establishment.  This place will need some better training or leadership! I'm shocked and I will never recommend this place to anyone, disgusting!

The service was great for the to go order. The food could have been better. The food was not put together too neat and I could not eat it. I think that people should slow down when preparing food, because its a reflection of them and their mood. The Management was  jumping in, but bar area  for to go orders needs some help.
Every time I come here I sit in the bar area, ALL the bartenders are so friendly and efficient. The buzz mac and cheese burger is the BEST thing on the menu!!

Absolutely horrible experience! Just left this establishment and both of us have food poisoning. When I've brought my concerns up with the manager, he was insistent that his food is safe to eat and prepared correctly. To compensate, he given me a partial refund in form of gift card that doesn't even cover the cost of the sandwich! I do not live anywhere near a Red Robin, nor will I use it since I do not plan on going to any of their establishments ever again. I cannot get the thought of explosive bowel movements projectile vomiting out of my head from what has happened today. I've reached out to corporate offices in Colorado, they've yet to help.

I'm mad!   We went there today and as soon as we got our drinks, the waitress spilled the soda all over me!  I was drenched.   My shorts were wet and all we got was a quick apology followed by lousy service and food for $50!!! After the waitress spilled drinks all over me and our table, she didn't have the common sense nor courtesy to move us to another table.   We HAD TO ASK for a new table because the waitress wasn't thinking about our comfort, we got a new table and then had two ask twice for her to bring us new drinks.  We got the drinks and that was followed by stale, hard and overcooked fries!   They actually snapped in half and they were dry inside.    I asked the waitress who was not interested in serving us for new fries two times and each basket was overcooked and dry.   We also had to wait a long time to get refills.   I really feel that the waitress was avoiding us and I wasn't even showing a cat butt face when she poured coke all over me.   I was gracious about it.  Too bad they're not gracious.  Not even a deduction was given for the drink they spilled all over me.  Nothing.   Nothing but a big fat bill for $50 for bad service and bad food! This place is hit or miss.  Avoid this place if all possible!  It's bad!  Find another Red Robin location.

I used to come here with my friends when I was in high school, seems like years ago now. Well I decide to swing by for lunch for old times sake, and it's just not as good as I remember. I ordered the grilled chicken teriyaki sandwhich, it was dripping in mayo and they just threw a piece of pineapple from a can in it. Really? They couldn't even grill it at least !? Even Carl's jr and habit grill know how to make it the right way. Service was slow, and the fries were soggy. Idk about this place, I believe it's seen better days.

I like this spot. Great, juicy burgers and cold brews that really help the pallet. It's a fun place and they have a nice friendly atmosphere to boot.  I come for the beer and stay for the burgers .. oh and the onion tower is the bomb!
Really terrible for a Red Robin. My child was given food on a severely chipped plate. She ordered oranges as her side and go THREE wedges. Service was slow. Food was chain stock at least.

For the first time I tried out take out gourmet burgers ordered on my App. I was very happy that the process was smooth, the packaging of the food excellent which helped maintain the quality of the burger.  I really have no complaints about ordering from Red Robin take out as it was speedy and the burgers tasted fresh and juicy.
Visited around 3pm and sat in the bar area. Food was great and so was the service! Ordered Bone-in Buffalo Wings and the Sriracha Tavern Burger

Party of 10 given a 30 min wait that was close to 50. 2 of our meals weren't entere d in ti the order and arrived way late. One meal was severly over cooked.  The worst part of our experience was mine...  Dining out as a vegetarian is always questionable and I realize the risk. Tonight I bit, chewed and swallowed a large piece of chicken on my lettuce wrapped veggie burger- weird large chunk that certainly didn't belong. I consumed chicken after 20 years of not eating meat. Absolutely dumbfounded. Over it! No more Red Robin for me. Vegetarian  orders should be treated in the same manner allergy orders are!

Not a great visit, but it was still good.  Our server was slow and so was the kitchen.  But there was one guy bussing that was running circles around everyone else. Ordered a hamburger at RR for the first time. It was good, thick and juicy, not one of those frozen little patties. My favorite there has always been the teriyaki chicken sandwich. It's amazing! The fries are good there, the thick steak fries. And you can have all you want. They have dipping sauces, too; the ranch is really good. Their freckled lemonade actually has strawberries in it...yumm!

Horrible service. I hit the call server button on the kiosk and 10 minutes later the server put her phone down and came over. I ordered two things to complete my dinner then after another twenty minutes I waved down the manager. Let's see how long this takes. Absolutely ridiculous and it's not even that busy. I see why now. I will never return to this place.

We came here because we like the bottomless fries. Garlic fries are delicious but it took forever to get a second/ third basket. Food took a while to get delivered and our waiter was just okay. I ordered the lettuce wrapped burger and it wasn't really good, the meat was really dry. My husbands hamburger was also just okay. We really enjoyed again the fries and strawberry lemonade.
Always good! Service varies but they do a good job. No complaints. Rewards program pays off.

Everything was going real good tell the cockroach wondered onto my table. I thought it was nice of the waitress to try to kill it for us, But had to move tables cause I was freaked out. And wasn't even offered anything discounted or a free desert. I won't be back!

We used to go all the time. The food is good, but honestly the service at both Fresno/Clovis locations sucks and the servers are so stingy with the bottomless fries. We've even had to go so far as to go to the bar to get our own drink refills. It's becoming a bit disappointing.

Very family friendly. Nice that the kid meals come with unlimited portions of their sides and drink choices. And that there is an activity menu/page to keep them occupied, especially when the wait on our last visit took a while to get out. The waitress was very friendly and patient with our table; Our orders came out correctly, but the kid's meals were incorrect in that the sides were the wrong choices and the preference forgotten. Food tasted delicious otherwise.

My family and I came in on a Saturday evening for dinner. The restaurant was super busy. We waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated. Our server Camille was amazing! I've never had such great service at a Red Robin. She went above and beyond and really tried to make sure we were all happy. The food itself was pretty good. The fries are my favorite. I got the California chicken burger. It was good but didn't have much guacamole on it. I noticed the buns are a little different. They tend to fall apart more and seem a little cheap. I wish they would change that because they stuff so much into the burgers that the buns can't handle it. Any who, my family and I love coming to Red Robin, mainly for the fries so we'll be back even if their buns are crappy.
